answers.answer: You can not cure PCOS, you will have it for the rest of your life. But, you can relieve some of the symptoms. You and your doctor will work together to come up with an option that best suits you. This can be anywhere from birth control, hormone therapy, diet, exercise, or other options. There are many things you can do to help the situation. Usually with PCOS, when you and your husband have decided to conceive, you and doctor should discuss options. A lot of women tend to turn towards fertility or diabetic mecication to help them conceive. Clomid is a very common one. I wish you luck.

Just one little thing to add. Some women with PCOS can conceive naturally.  I've had 2 children "accidentally" with PCOS but without any treatment (in fact, I tried to conceive for 6+ months with the first of the two and ended up getting pregnant the first month we stopped trying).  Many more women see success with the methods listed above.  PCOS does not necessarily prevent you from having any children - but it will be a longer road to get there.

I've had PCOS for three now and dont know all about it, most docs dont know everything or dont have time to give you the information you need. I started reading this book " The PCOS protection plan" by colette harris and theresa cheung-  a couple days ago and I have been informed of a lot of issues related with and b/c of PCOS. I highly recommend this book to all woman suffering from PCOS.
